example.eg: Corinne was annoyed when her boyfriend did not turn up at the expected time.
example.egtrans: 由于男朋友没能在预期的时间出现，科琳很不高兴。

example.eg: My great-grandmother's death was sad, but expected; she was 99.
example.egtrans: 曾祖母的过世令人悲伤，不过也毫不意外，毕竟她已经99岁高龄了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 毫不意外的, 意料之中的

example.eg: We can expect rain later today over much of the country.
example.egtrans: 预计全国大部分地区都将有降雨。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 预计, 预期, 预料

example.eg: I expect our team will lose again.  Big business is expected to maintain America's ability to compete in the world market.
example.egtrans: 我预计我们的球队又会输。人们预计大型企业能够保持住美国在全球市场中的竞争力。

example.eg: I expect that he got lost again.
I'm expecting a package in the mail.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 期待, 盼望, 等待

example.eg: As your employer, I expect perfection; this work isn't good enough!
example.egtrans: 作为你的雇主，我要求完美，这个结果并不能达到这个要求！

example.eg: I expect an apology from you.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 向…要求, 认为…有必要

example.eg: The editor expects high journalistic standards of all his reporters.
example.egtrans: 编辑要求所有记者都能写出高质量的新闻稿。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 对某人有…的要求, 对某人有…的期待

example.eg: The England team expect to win their match against Sweden.
example.egtrans: 英格兰队认为他们能够战胜瑞典队。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 认为某人会做某事, 预料某人会做某事

example.eg: I'm expecting a baby in July.  My wife is expecting twins.
example.egtrans: 七月，我正怀着孩子。我的妻子怀着双胞胎。

example.eg: As expected, all the crops withered because of the drought.
It rained more than expected last night.
The number of people attending the match was more than expected.
Gifts from them are not to be expected.
